description:
Python 3.6 has turned out to be quite the release! With `16 Python
Enhancement Proposals <https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0494/>`__
incorporated into the version, Python 3.6 is only surpassed by Python
3.0 for having more `PEPs <https://www.python.org/dev/peps/>`__ included
in a single release. This talk will be an overview of those 16 PEPs and
other changes outlined in the `What's
New <https://docs.python.org/3.6/whatsnew/3.6.html>`__ document for
Python 3.6.
title: What's new in Python 3.6
